title: O-Zone - Disco Zone
description: DiscO-Zone is the third and final album that was produced and released by the Moldovan band O-Zone. It was first released on June 6, 2004 in multiple countries throughout Europe under the label Polydor Records. It was also released in the United States under the label Ultra Records on 2 November 2004, in Australia by Mushroom Records on the same date, and in Japan under Avex Trax on 24 August 2005.[1] It features their hit singles "Dragostea din tei (Love from Lime)" and "Despre Tine (About You)". The album was a commercial success in many European countries, particularly in Portugal where it was hit number one for eight consecutive weeks and was ranked for 26 weeks in the top 30. It also reached the top ten in Wallonia (Belgium),[2] Poland,[3] Norway,[4] Switzerland,[5] and Finland.[6] In France, it was number 15 but stayed for 36 weeks in the top 200. In Japan it reached the number one position in its 24th week on the chart.
